title: Mourning the death of Jeffrey J. Zogg, distinguished citizen and devoted member of his community
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  mourning  the death of Jeffrey J. Zogg, distin-
guished citizen and devoted member of his community

WHEREAS, It is the custom of this Legislative Body  to  pay  tribute  to
citizens  of  the  State  of  New York whose lifework and civic endeavor
served to enhance the quality of life in their communities and the great
State of New York; and
  WHEREAS, Jeffrey J. Zogg of Delmar, New York, died on Sunday,  October
24, 2010, at the age of 61; and
  WHEREAS,  Born  in  Syracuse,  New York, to the late Hazel and Richard
Zogg, Jeffrey J. Zogg graduated from Brown University in  1971,  married
his  high  school  sweetheart, Marie, and moved to Albany where he began
his career as an association executive in the construction  industry  at
the General Building Contractors Association of New York State; and
  WHEREAS,  Jeffrey J. Zogg was the director of Government Relations for
the General Building Contractors Association from 1971 until  1986  when
he became the managing director; and
  WHEREAS, After a recent merger between the Associated General Contrac-
tors-Highway  Division  and the General Building Contractors, Jeffrey J.
Zogg became the CEO of the newly formed Associated  General  Contractors
of New York State, LLC; and
  WHEREAS,  Passionate  about  his work as all who met him quickly real-
ized, Jeffrey J. Zogg distinguished himself in his profession and by his
sincere dedication and substantial contribution to the  welfare  of  his
community; and
  WHEREAS,  His  commitment  to  excellence, and his spirit of humanity,
carried over into all fields of  enterprise,  including  charitable  and
civic endeavors; and
  WHEREAS,  Jeffrey J. Zogg was a certified arbitrator with the American
Arbitration Association and served on the Business Council of  New  York
State  as well as numerous other local and national professional associ-
ations; and
  WHEREAS, In addition to his work, Jeffrey J. Zogg was an avid New York
Yankees fan having gone to the Yankees Fantasy Camp as  a  special  40th
birthday present from his wife; and
  WHEREAS,  Above  all,  he cherished time spent with his family whether
every night at the dinner table or on annual summer  vacations  on  Cape
Cod;  a  devoted,  loving, and generous father and husband, Jeffrey Zogg
lived his life according to the AGC motto: "skill, integrity,  responsi-
bility"; and
  WHEREAS,  Jeffrey  J. Zogg is survived by his wife of 39 years, Marie;
and his two children, Jennifer and Jason, all of whom were proud to be a
part of his life and rejoiced in his achievements; and
  WHEREAS, Armed with a  humanistic  spirit,  imbued  with  a  sense  of
compassion,  and  comforted  by  a loving family, Jeffrey J. Zogg leaves
behind a legacy which will long endure the  passage  of  time  and  will
remain  as  a  comforting  memory  to all he served and befriended; now,
therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
mourn  the  death  of Jeffrey J. Zogg, distinguished citizen and devoted
member of his community; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to the family of Jeffrey J. Zogg.
